body.p: The Extensible HyperText Markup Language (XHTML), is a markup language that has the same depth of expression as HTML, but also conforms to XML syntax.

section.title: File Definition
section.p: A file is considered to be an XHTML document when the root element is html.

section.title: Default Document Templates
section.p: There are a variety of default XHTML templates available when creating new documents from templatesnew documents from templates and they can be found in: Framework Templates XHTML .
The default templates for XHTML documents are located in the /frameworks/xhtml/templates/ folder.

section.title: Default Schema for Validation and Content Completion
section.p:
Default schemas that are used if one is not detected in the XHTML file are stored in the following locations:
XHTML 1.0 - /frameworks/xhtml/dtd/ or /frameworks/xhtml/nvdl/.
XHTML 1.1 - /frameworks/xhtml11/dtd/ or /frameworks/xhtml11/schema/.
XHTML 5 - /frameworks/xhtml/xhtml5 (epub3)/.

section.title: Default CSS
section.p: The default CSS files used for rendering XHTML content in Author mode are stored in /frameworks/xhtml/css/.
By default, these default CSS files are merged with any that are specified in the document. For more information, see .

section.title: Default XML Catalogs
section.p:
The default XML Catalogs for the XHTML document type are as follows:
/frameworks/xhtml/dtd/xhtmlcatalog.xml
/frameworks/relaxng/catalog.xml
/frameworks/nvdl/catalog.xml
/frameworks/xhtml11/dtd/xhtmlcatalog.xml
/frameworks/xhtml11/schema/xhtmlcatalog.xml
/xhtml5 (epub3)/catalog-compat.xml

section.title: Transformation Scenarios
section.p: includes built-in transformation scenarios that allow you to transform XHTML documents to several types of DITA document types (topic, task, concept, reference). They can be found in the XHTML section in the Configure Transformation Scenario(s) dialog box.
